metadata.title: CVE-2024-35927 on Ubuntu 20.04 LTS (focal) - medium
metadata.description: In the Linux kernel, the following vulnerability has been resolved:drm: Check output polling initialized before disablingIn drm_kms_helper_poll_disable() check if output pollingsupport is initialized before disabling polling. If not flagthis as a warning.Additionally in drm_mode_config_helper_suspend() anddrm_mode_config_helper_resume() calls, that re the callers of thesefunctions, avoid invoking them if polling is not initialized.For drivers like hyperv-drm, that do not initialize connectorpolling, if suspend is called without this check, it leads tosuspend failure with following stack[  770.719392] Freezing remaining freezable tasks ...
